alert.note: Alert for Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued June 20 at 2:11PM PDT until June 21 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * UPDATE...Removed warning from the Cascades and higher terrain in Siskiyou County. Low temperatures are not impactful in these areas. No changes to other areas or possible impacts. * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures from the mid-30s to mid-20s expected. * WHERE...In California, Northeast Siskiyou County and Modoc County. In Oregon, Klamath County east of the Cascades and Lake County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 8 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
